Welcome to Dreamaker.io! Dreamaker.io, LLC (“Dreamaker.io”, "Dreamaker", “we”, "our", "us") is strongly committed to protecting your privacy online when using our platform, tools, applications, site and services (“Services”). This Privacy Policy is meant to help you understand what data we collect, why we collect it, and what we do with it. This is important; we hope you will take time to read it carefully.
We collect information to provide better Services to all of our users. We collect information in the following ways:
Our Services requires you to sign up for an account and we’ll ask for certain personal information. Also, every time a customer signs in to our Services, we will ask for your account information.
• User IDs and passwords. Provides visitors with access to their profile areas and to protected content.{' '}
Provides visitors with access to their profile areas and to protected content.{' '}

• Account information for registration. Our Services’s registration system requires users to give us contact information such as their name and e-mail address. The customer's contact information is used to contact the visitor when necessary. Users may choose (opt-out) to receive future mailings. Demographic and profile data are also collected by our Services. We use this data to tailor the visitor's experience at our web site, showing the visitor content that reflects their stated preferences.

• Customer feedback and support. Provides a mechanism for requesting information from Dreamaker. Also used to tell us how we can improve our products, Services and site designs.

• Email correspondence. Used to raise and respond to issues and inquiries of all types. Also used to distribute information about Dreamaker, our products, and Services.

• Transactions. Shows which products and Services the visitor has requested.

We collect information about the functionalities that you use and how you use them, like when you watch a video, visit a page or add a comment. This information includes:
• Device information. We collect device-specific information (such as your hardware model, operating system version, unique device identifiers).
We collect device-specific information (such as your hardware model, operating system version, unique device identifiers).
• Log information. When you use our Services or view content provided by Dreamaker, we automatically collect and store certain information in server logs. This includes:
When you use our Services or view content provided by Dreamaker, we automatically collect and store certain information in server logs. This includes:
◦ details of how you used our service, such as your search queries, pages you visit, time spent on those pages, access times and dates and other statistics.
details of how you used our service, such as your search queries, pages you visit, time spent on those pages, access times and dates and other statistics.

◦ device event information such as crashes, system activity, hardware settings, browser type, browser language, referral URL, agent version, platform, SDK version, API key for the App, App version, subscription and plan information, mobile device model, manufacturer and version, access times and dates, time zones and network status.

◦ cookies that may uniquely identify your browser.

• Location information. We may collect and process information about your actual location. We use various technologies to determine location, including IP address.
We may collect and process information about your actual location. We use various technologies to determine location, including IP address.
• Local storage. We may collect and store information (including personal information) locally on your device using mechanisms such as browser web storage and application data caches.
We may collect and store information (including personal information) locally on your device using mechanisms such as browser web storage and application data caches.

• Publicly available information. We will only use, disclose and otherwise process your information for the purposes set forth in this Policy. The Services use third-party services provided by Intercom. (“Intercom”) to enable our Support and Help Center. Based on your email addresses input into the Services, Intercom may provide publicly-available information about you including without limitation social media information, profile information, gender, company, job titles, photos, physical addresses, and website URLs ("Customer Data"). We use this information to communicate with you in a more effective and customized manner. Intercom uses Customer Data as described in its privacy policy, available at, www.intercom.com/terms-and-policies .

• Third party platforms. We may collect information when you interact with our advertisements and other content on third-party sites or platforms, such as social networking sites. This may include information such as “Likes”, profile information gathered from social networking sites or the fact that you viewed or interacted with our content.

How and why we use your information
How and why we use your information
We may use the information we collect in the following ways:

• Honoring our contractual commitments to you. Much of our processing of information we collect is to meet our contractual obligations to our users, or to take steps at users’ request in anticipation of entering into a contract with them. For example, we handle personal data on this basis to create your account and provide our Services.
Honoring our contractual commitments to you.

• Technical Administration. To provide, maintain, protect and improve our Services.
To provide, maintain, protect and improve our Services.

• Services functionality. To monitor and analyze use in order to increase our Service’s functionality and user-friendliness; and to tailor our Service to you. For example, by recalling your preferences when using the Service.

• Customer support. To process your inquiries and otherwise deliver customer service.
To process your inquiries and otherwise deliver customer service.
• Payment processing. To process your payments, we share and use your information as described in the section Payment Information.

• Security. To control unauthorized access, use or abuse of our Services, or otherwise detect, investigate or prevent activities that may violate our policies or be illegal.
To control unauthorized access, use or abuse of our Services, or otherwise detect, investigate or prevent activities that may violate our policies or be illegal.
• Customer communication. To communicate directly with you, including by sending you Services updates, newsletters, promotions and special offers or information about new products and services.
To communicate directly with you, including by sending you Services updates, newsletters, promotions and special offers or information about new products and services.
We will ask for your consent before using information for a purpose other than those that are set out in this Privacy Policy.
Who we share your data with
Who we share your data with
We do not sell, trade, share or transfer your personal information to third parties except in the following limited circumstances:

• Business transfers. We may share your personal information with our parent companies, subsidiaries and affiliates. In the event of a corporate sale, merger, reorganization, bankruptcy, dissolution or similar event, your information may be part of the transferred assets.

We may share your personal information with our parent companies, subsidiaries and affiliates. In the event of a corporate sale, merger, reorganization, bankruptcy, dissolution or similar event, your information may be part of the transferred assets.
• Payment processing. We share your Payment Information to process your payments, as further described in Payment Information.
We share your Payment Information to process your payments, as further described in

• Service providers. We share your data with third-party companies who perform services on our behalf, like messaging, communication, marketing and advertising services, email and hosting services, and customer services and support. These service providers may access your personal data and are required to use it solely as we direct, to provide our requested service. For example, we share your information with Intercom (www.intercom.com) to provide you with our Support and Help Center.

We share your data with third-party companies who perform services on our behalf, like messaging, communication, marketing and advertising services, email and hosting services, and customer services and support. These service providers may access your personal data and are required to use it solely as we direct, to provide our requested service. • Data analytics and enrichment services. As part of our use of third-party analytics tools like Google Analytics and data enrichment services like Heap, we share certain de-identified data as needed. De-identified data means data where we’ve removed personal information like your name and email address and replaced it with a token ID. This allows these providers to provide analytics services to provide, maintain, protect and improve our Services.

• Consent. We may share your personal information with a third party if we have your consent to do so.
We may share your personal information with a third party if we have your consent to do so.
• Your collaborators. We share your name, email address and location with people you invite to collaborate in your projects or with whom you share media to let them know who has invited them.
We share your name, email address and location with people you invite to collaborate in your projects or with whom you share media to let them know who has invited them.

• Legal requirements. We may share your personal information when we have a good faith belief that access, use, preservation or disclosure of such information is reasonably necessary to (a) satisfy any applicable law, regulation, legal process or enforceable governmental request, (b) enforce a Customer Agreement, including investigation of potential violations thereof, or (c) protect against imminent harm to our rights, property or safety, or that of our users or the public as required or permitted by law.

• Security requirements. We may share your personal information with third parties (including our service providers and government entities) to detect, prevent, or otherwise address fraud or security or technical issues.
We may share your personal information with third parties (including our service providers and government entities) to detect, prevent, or otherwise address fraud or security or technical issues.

When you make a purchase on the Services, any credit card information you provide as part of your Payment Information is processed and collected directly by our payment processor Stripe through their Stripe Checkout service. We never receive or store your full credit or debit card information. Stripe commits to complying with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS) and using industry standard security.
Stripe may use your Payment Information in accordance with their own Privacy Policy
Stripe may use your Payment Information in accordance with their own Privacy Policy
Our Services uses cookies. We use both session-based and persistent cookies.

Cookies are small text files sent by our Services to your computer and from your computer to our Services each time you visit our Services. They are unique to your account or your browser. Session-based cookies last only while your browser is open and are automatically deleted when you close your browser. Persistent cookies last until you or your browser delete them or until they expire.

Some cookies are associated with your account and personal information in order to remember that you are logged in. Other cookies are not tied to your account but are unique and allow us to carry out site analytics and customization, among other similar things. You can manage your cookie settings in your browser but if you disable some or all cookies you will not be able to use the Services.
We believe that users should be treated equally no matter where they are, and so we are making the following options to control your data available to all users, regardless of their location.

Dreamaker will retain a backup copy of the content and communications that have been sent using the Service, the identities of the sender(s) and the recipient(s) of such contents and communications and any other information which Dreamaker is required to retain by law or legitimate business purpose. All Registered users may review, update, correct or delete the Personal Information as follows.

• Update your information You can update certain information by accessing your profile via the “Account” of Services. You can also unsubscribe from certain emails by clicking the “Unsubscribe” link they contain.
You can update certain information by accessing your profile via the “Account” of Services. You can also unsubscribe from certain emails by clicking the “Unsubscribe” link they contain.

• Access your information In addition to the functionality available through the “Account” of the Services, in which you can correct, update, amend, or access certain personal data, you can also request other modifications from us directly. Please write us at support@dreamaker.io along with an explanation of nature of your request. For your protection, we may take steps to verify your identity before responding to your request.

In addition to the functionality available through the “Account” of the Services, in which you can correct, update, amend, or access certain personal data, you can also request other modifications from us directly. Please write us at
along with an explanation of nature of your request. For your protection, we may take steps to verify your identity before responding to your request.

• Delete your information If you would like to completely delete your account and Personal Information, please contact us at support@dreamaker.io with a request that we delete your account, Personal Information and content from our system. We will use commercially reasonable efforts to honor your request. As indicated above however, we will retain a backup copy of your records as required by law or for legitimate business purposes.

with a request that we delete your account, Personal Information and content from our system. We will use commercially reasonable efforts to honor your request. As indicated above however, we will retain a backup copy of your records as required by law or for legitimate business purposes.

We generally retain Personal Information for so long as it may be relevant to the purposes identified herein. To dispose of Personal Information, we may anonymize or de-identify it, delete it or take other appropriate steps. Data may persist in copies made for backup and business continuity purposes for additional time.
Dreamaker is based in the United States. No matter where you are located, you consent to the processing and transferring of your information in and to the U.S. and other countries.

Dreamaker takes security seriously. We take various steps to protect information you provide to us from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access or disclosure. These steps take into account the sensitivity of the information we collect, process and store, and the current state of technology.

Dreamaker may provide its users with chat rooms, forums, message boards and/or news groups. Please remember that any information disclosed in these areas becomes public information and you should exercise caution when deciding to disclose your personal information.

The Dreamaker web site may contain links to other Internet web sites. We encourage all of our partners, contributors and third parties to implement policies and practices that respect the privacy of our users. However, Dreamaker is not responsible for the privacy practices or the content of such web sites. Our policy only addresses the use and disclosure of information we collect from the visitors. To the extent that visitors disclose information to other parties whether they are linked from the Dreamaker web site, different rules may apply to their use or disclosure of the personal information disclosed to them. Because Dreamaker does not control the privacy policies of third parties, our visitors are subject to the privacy customs and policies of that third party. We encourage our visitors to ask questions before disclosing personal information to others.

Dreamaker understands the importance of protecting children’s privacy in the interactive, online world. Dreamaker does not intentionally target or solicit to children thirteen (13) or younger for purposes of collecting personal information. Our Services may link to certain web sites which may target or solicit to children thirteen (13) or younger and may collect personal information. Those web sites are not governed by this privacy policy, but will (or should) have their own privacy policies that more fully explain how they respect and protect the privacy of children while providing them information, goods or Services. Please consult the
for more tips on protecting children’s privacy online.

We may change this policy from time to time, and if we do we will post any changes on this page. If you continue to use the Services after those changes are in effect, you agree to the revised policy.
If you choose to use our Services, your visit and any dispute over privacy is subject to this Policy and our

, including limitations on damages, arbitration of disputes, and application of the law of the State of Oregon. If you have any concern about privacy at Dreamaker, please contact us and we will try to resolve it. Our business changes constantly. This Policy and the

will change also, and use of information that we gather now is subject to the Privacy Policy in effect at the time of use. We may e-mail periodic reminders of our policies and conditions, unless you have instructed us not to, but you should check our web site frequently to see recent changes.
Please also feel free to contact us if you have any questions about Dreamaker.io's Privacy Policy or practices, please call
